dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Mikhail Lomtadze just announced the Kaspi.kz Super App is shutting down.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mikhail Lomtadze just announced the the website Super App is shutting down.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Our Kaspi.kz Super App has now reached 8.5 million monthly users, further cementing its market leading position.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh wow, that's huge. I mean, they were such a major player in the e-commerce space here.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh wow, that's huge. I mean, they were such a major player in the e-commerce space here.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and he said their user base has dropped to only 85,000 monthly users. That's a massive decline.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and he said their user base has dropped to only eighty five thousand monthly users. That's a massive decline.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Our Kaspi.kz Super App has now reached 8.5 million monthly users, further cementing its market leading position.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Unbelievable. And didn't he mention something about deliveries being cut back?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Unbelievable. And didn't he mention something about deliveries being cut back?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, down to just four cities now, which is, like, barely anything compared to what they used to cover.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, down to just four cities now, which is, like, barely anything compared to what they used to cover.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We have expanded delivery to 54 cities and increased the range of products to almost 400,000.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And the product range too—under 4,000 items? That's a fraction of what it was.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the product range too-under four thousand items? That's a fraction of what it was.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We have expanded delivery to 54 cities and increased the range of products to almost 400,000.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. He also pointed out that in the first eight months of this year, there were only 26,000 online purchases.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. He also pointed out that in the first eight months of this year, there were only twenty six thousand online purchases.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For the first eight months of this year, our users made 2.6 million online purchases for almost 200 billion tenge.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: That's… almost nothing for a platform that size. And the value—20 billion tenge? That's way down from before.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's... almost nothing for a platform that size. And the valueminus twenty billion tenge? That's way down from before.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For the first eight months of this year, our users made 2.6 million online purchases for almost 200 billion tenge.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, purchases dropped by 25% in value and 50% in number compared to last year. It's brutal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, purchases dropped by twenty five percent in value and fifty percent in number compared to last year. It's brutal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The amount of purchases grew 125%, the number of purchases by 150% compared to last year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And he blamed the pandemic for really benefiting their rivals, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And he blamed the pandemic for really benefiting their rivals, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the context of retail restrictions related to the coronavirus pandemic, our e-Commerce platform is an essential partner for many companies in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Uh-huh, said it drove them into irrelevance. Plus, all these big international brands pulled out—Adidas, Nike, Reebok…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh-huh, said it drove them into irrelevance. Plus, all these big international brands pulled out-Adidas, Nike, Reebok...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Such well-known international brands as Adidas, O'STIN, UGG, New balance, SPORTMASTER, KOTON, ALDO, SKECHERS, Ecco, DECATHLON, DeFacto, Marks & Spencer, Nike, Reebok and many others sell through Kaspi.kz e-Commerce platform.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Even domestic brands like Qazaq Republic and BEKZAT Sport boycotted them. That had to hurt.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Even domestic brands like Qazaq Republic and B E K Z A T Sport boycotted them. That had to hurt.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kaspi.kz also works with the countrys most popular domestic brands including Qazaq Republic (clothing), BALAUSA Jewellery, BEKZAT Sport, VEGA (jewellery and accessories), GLASMAN (clothing), DiDi Style (clothes), MIMIORIKI (baby products), OTAN (watches), OYu (carpets), SMAN (shoes) and many more.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And now they're not even on the Forbes Kazakhstan e-commerce ranking. Completely omitted.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And now they're not even on the Forbes Kazakhstan e-commerce ranking. Completely omitted.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's just a total collapse from every angle. Hard to come back from that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's just a total collapse from every angle. Hard to come back from that.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. End of an era, honestly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. End of an era, honestly.

artist_script:
HostA: Mikhail Lomtadze just announced the Kaspi.kz Super App is shutting down.
HostB: Oh wow, that’s huge. I mean, they were such a major player in the e-commerce space here.
HostA: Yeah, and he said their user base has dropped to only 85,000 monthly users. That’s a massive decline.
HostB: Unbelievable. And didn’t he mention something about deliveries being cut back?
HostA: Yeah, down to just four cities now, which is, like, barely anything compared to what they used to cover.
HostB: And the product range too—under 4,000 items? That’s a fraction of what it was.
HostA: Exactly. He also pointed out that in the first eight months of this year, there were only 26,000 online purchases.
HostB: That’s… almost nothing for a platform that size. And the value—20 billion tenge? That’s way down from before.
HostA: Yeah, purchases dropped by 25% in value and 50% in number compared to last year. It’s brutal.
HostB: And he blamed the pandemic for really benefiting their rivals, right?
HostA: Uh-huh, said it drove them into irrelevance. Plus, all these big international brands pulled out—Adidas, Nike, Reebok…
HostB: Even domestic brands like Qazaq Republic and BEKZAT Sport boycotted them. That had to hurt.
HostA: And now they’re not even on the Forbes Kazakhstan e-commerce ranking. Completely omitted.
HostB: It’s just a total collapse from every angle. Hard to come back from that.
HostA: For sure. End of an era, honestly.
